title: Shizen Energy Invests in Juice Manufacturer/retailer
text:
Shizen Energy Invests in Juice Manufacturer/retailer Shizen Energy Invests in Juice Manufacturer/retailer 2015/09/02 08:53 Kenji Kaneko, Nikkei BP CleanTech Institute EJ's store that produces, sells and delivers Cold Press Juice (source: Shizen Energy) 
Shizen Energy Inc announced Aug 26, 2015, that it has invested in EJ KK (Bunkyo-ku, Tokyo), which produces, processes and sells agricultural products. 
Shizen Energy (Chuo-ku, Fukuoka City) is a company that develops solar power plants. 
The major industry in the areas around the sites of solar power plants in Japan is, in many cases, agriculture. Shizen Energy aims to revitalize local economies by strengthening connection to agriculture through investment. 
EJ was established in April 2015 and has been engaged in the promotion of the "sixth industry" for improving the added values of agriculture. As its initial project, the company runs stores that produce, sell and deliver "Cold Press Juice/Soup," which is made by using agricultural products. 
EJ opened "EJ Juice and Soup Koujimachi Shop" in Tokyo Aug 5, 2015. The company plans to grow agricultural products by itself. 
Cold Press Juice is made by squishing vegetables, fruits, etc while preventing heat generation. Compared with normal juices and smoothies, it reportedly enables to take in the maximum amounts of nutrients and enzymes of ingredients and absorb nutrients without imposing a burden on digestive organs. It started booming in urban areas of the US, and the number of shops dealing with the juice began to increase in Japan in about 2014.
